etymologies: late Middle English: from French mixture or Latin mixtura (see mixed)

definitions: a substance made by mixing other substances together

examples.text: form the mixture into a manageable dough
shandy is a mixture of beer and lemonade

definitions: the process of mixing or being mixed.
a combination of different qualities, things, or emotions in which the component elements are individually distinct

examples.text: the old town is a mixture of narrow medieval streets and 18th-century architecture
she thumped the pillow with a mixture of anger and frustration

shortDefinitions: combination in which components are distinct

definitions: a person regarded as a combination of qualities and attributes

examples.text: he was a curious mixture, an unpredictable man

shortDefinitions: person regarded as combination of qualities

definitions: the product of the random distribution of one substance through another without any chemical reaction, as distinct from a compound.
shortDefinitions: product of random distribution of one substance through another without chemical reaction

definitions: the charge of gas or vapor mixed with air which is admitted to the cylinder of an internal combustion engine, especially as regards the ratio of fuel to air

examples.text: newer pilots often leave their mixture rich during an entire flight

shortDefinitions: combination of gas and air admitted to cylinder of engine

definitions: an organ stop in which each key sounds a group of small pipes of different pitches, giving a very bright tone.
shortDefinitions: organ stop sounding pipes of different pitches
